item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS 15.2 breaks the ability to copy the OS to another drive (167 points | 61 comments)
2. Luon programming language (87 points | 32 comments)
3. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (187 points | 26 comments)

5. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (161 points | 43 comments)
6. Htmx 2.0.4 Released (79 points | 26 comments)
7. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (77 points | 27 comments)
8. Mysterious tablet with unknown language unearthed in Georgia (41 points | 15 comments)
9. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (125 points | 28 comments)
10. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (152 points | 75 comments)
11. Making my first robot as a software engineer (223 points | 27 comments)
12. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (157 points | 25 comments)
13. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (101 points | 39 comments)
14. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (10 points | discuss)
15. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (153 points | 18 comments)
16. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (162 points | 108 comments)

18. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (404 points | 143 comments)

20. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (92 points | 32 comments)
21. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (172 points | 46 comments)
22. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (418 points | 443 comments)
23. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (65 points | 24 comments)
24. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (227 points | 59 comments)
25. SCCS roach motel (46 points | 11 comments)
26. Pompeii experts back Pliny's account of Mount Vesuvius eruption date (35 points | 17 comments)
27. Test (465 points | 108 comments)
28. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
29. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (379 points | 187 comments)
30. NASA believes it understands why Ingenuity crashed on Mars (64 points | 39 comments)
